description: These Hungarian Christmas walnut crescent cookies have a sweet, nutty filling inside a flakey, rich pastry, heavily sprinkled with icing sugar mixed with vanilla flavored sugar.
ingredients: [{"name": "all purpose flour", "units": "cups", "amount": "1 3/4"}, {"name": "butter", "units": "grams", "amount": "200"}, {"name": "lemon zest", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "sour cream", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/2 - 3/4"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "pinch", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "whole milk", "units": "cup", "amount": "0.25"}, {"name": "powdered sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": "0.25"}, {"name": "finely ground walnuts", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "lemon zest", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "0.5"}, {"name": "powdered sugar mixed with vanilla flavored sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}]
instructions: For the dough, mix the flour and salt with cubed butter until crumbly. Add lemon zest and sour cream, knead into a soft dough, cover, and let rest for 20 minutes. For the filling, boil milk, add powdered sugar, ground walnuts, and lemon zest, mix well, and let cool. Preheat oven to 180°C (355°F). Roll out dough, cut circles, place filling, roll into crescents, and bake until slightly colored, about 25 minutes. Roll in powdered sugar mixture immediately after baking.
notes: Can be made in advance and stored in a cool, dry place. Alternative fillings can be used.
